dublinCore.dc:title: 115 HR 105 IH: Protect Veterans from Financial Fraud Act of 2017
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Brownley of California introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to ensure that the Secretary of Veterans Affairs repays the misused benefits of veterans with fiduciaries, to establish an appeals process for determinations by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs of veterans’ mental capacity, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Protect Veterans from Financial Fraud Act of 2017.

subsection.text: Section 6107(b) of title 38, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (1), by striking In any case in which a fiduciary described in paragraph (2) and inserting In any case not covered by subsection (a) in which a fiduciary;

subsection.text: The amendments made by subsection (a) shall apply with respect to the misuse of benefits by a fiduciary occurring on or after the date of the enactment of this Act.

section.header: Appeals for determinations of mental capacity
section.text: Section 5501A of title 38, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking The Secretary and inserting (a) In general.—The Secretary; and
by adding at the end the following new subsection:

subsection.text: A determination under subsection (a) may be appealed in accordance with chapters 71 and 72 of this title.
